USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: Lifeline Companies Near Me
resource.description: This dataset provides the information of all the carriers providing Lifeline service, their customer service number, service type, state, and URL. The purpose of this dataset is to provide the most accurate list of carriers providing service in a particular area within a given state, through the use of zip codes. To ensure that this data is up-to-date and accurate, it is refreshed periodically to add new carriers and the corresponding zip codes of their designated service areas, update the zip codes for existing carriers, and remove zip codes for carriers that have relinquished their ETC designation. In the event that a user enters a zip code that does not return any service provider(s), a complete listing of the state in which the zip code is found will be returned with the recommendation that the consumer confirm the availability of Lifeline service in their chosen zip code with a service provider from that state.
columns_description: Field no longer in use. Previously used to show ACP providers offering one or more plans that were covered in full by the ACP discount.
City of the area where the carrier provides service.
Zip code of the area where the carrier provides service.
Type of service provided by the carrier. It may be mobile service or home service offered through the Lifeline Program.
County of the area where the carrier provides service.
Customer service phone number of the carrier.
Full legal name of the carrier.
Field no longer in use. Previously used to show Affordable Connectivity Program (ACP) providers offering a one-time device discount of up to $100 to purchase a laptop, desktop computer, or tablet.
State where a Study Area Code (SAC) is designated.
URL of the carrier’s website.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset provides the information of all the carriers providing Lifeline service, their customer service number, service type, state, and URL for a particular zip code. The purpose of this dataset is to provide the most accurate list of carriers providing service in a particular area within a given state, through the use of zip codes. To ensure that this data is up-to-date and accurate, it is refreshed periodically to add new carriers and the corresponding zip codes of their designated service areas, update the zip codes for existing carriers, and remove zip codes for carriers that have relinquished their ETC designation. In the event that a user enters a zip code that does not return any service provider(s), a complete listing of the state in which the zip code is found will be returned with the recommendation that the consumer confirm the availability of Lifeline in their chosen zip code with a service provider from that state.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset is then noted with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0% to 100%. Any metric less than 100% means that users left certain fields blank when reporting the information to USAC.

resource.name: Rural Health Care Commitments and Disbursements (FCC Form 462/466/466A)
resource.description: This dataset contains data about funding decisions, total committed amounts, and total disbursement amounts for the Rural Health Care (RHC) Program. The data is collected from the FCC Form 462 (Funding Request Form, Health Care Connect Fund (HCF)), FCC Form 466 (Funding Request and Certification Form, Telecommunications program) and FCC Form 466A (Internet Service Funding Request and Certification Form, Telecommunications program). All information within the FCC Forms 462, 466, and 466A data collection is self-reported by applicants.

domain_metadata.value: This data set contains information collected from the FCC Forms 462, 466 and 466A which includes basic information about the applicant and service provider, information regarding the type of service requested, the funding start and end dates and information about the total committed amount and total disbursed amount.  All data contained within the FCC Forms 462 (Funding Request Form, Health Care Connect Fund (HCF) program), 466 (Funding Request and Certification Form, Telecommunications program), 466A (Internet Service Funding Request and Certification Form, Telecommunications program)  is self-reported by applicants to the Rural Health Care (RHC) program.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Any value less than 100 percent indicates a field with missing values.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC) information about schools, libraries, school districts, library systems, consortia, and non-instructional facilities (NIFs). For data about annexes, please reference the data set titled “E-Rate Annex Information”.  The data set is updated nightly and includes the latest updates to EPC entity profiles as of 9 p.m. ET from the previous day. Parent and child relationships are included in the data set for each entity. If a given entity has more than one parent (e.g., an entity that is a member of two consortia) the entity will be listed multiple times. The data set includes a field for entity status which indicates whether the entity is active or closed.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset is then noted with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0% - 100%. Any metric less than 100% means that applicants left certain fields blank when reporting the information to USAC.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains data from the basic information section of each FCC Form 471, including applicant details such as contact information, applicant type, Billed Entity Number (BEN), student count, dollars, and category of service, as well as related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC). Use this dataset to answer questions such as: What is the applicant entity’s student count? What will the category of service funding be used for? What is the contact information of the applicant?  All information within the Basic Information (FCC Form 471) dataset is self-reported by applicants.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: Rural Health Care Posted Services (FCC Form 461/465)
resource.description:
This dataset contains data allowing service providers to view service request information provided by individual Health Care Providers (HCPs) and consortia applying for funding through the Rural Health Care (RHC) Program. The data is collected from the FCC Forms 461 and 465, which includes the service request information. 

All data contained within the FCC Form 461 (Request for Services Form, Health Care Connect Fund (HCF) program) and 465 (Description of Services Requested & Certification Form, Telecommunications program) is self-reported by applicants to RHC.

resource.name: High Cost: Connect America Fund Broadband Map (CAF Map)
resource.description: This dataset serves as the foundation for the Connect America Fund Broadband Map (CAF Map), an interactive online map that shows the impact of the Connect America Fund (CAF) on broadband expansion to close the digital divide in rural America. The CAF Map displays the geographic areas that are eligible for CAF support, as well as the specific fixed locations where carriers participating in the program have built out mass-market, high-speed Internet service. The dataset includes address, latitude and longitude coordinates, carrier name,  filing year and minimum speeds offered for every location where CAF-supported service is available. The information in this dataset comes directly from carriers, which submit broadband deployment data annually through USAC’s High Cost Universal Broadband (HUBB) portal showing where they have built out service using CAF funding. The current CAF Map is based on data certified in the HUBB as of March 06, 2024, to reflect broadband deployment through Dec. 31, 2023. USAC independently verifies deployment to a random sample of locations reported in the HUBB each year to monitor carrier compliance with CAF build-out obligations.

resource.name: Rural Health Care Available Rates (FCC Forms 462/466/471)
resource.description:
This dataset displays rates of eligible services under the Telecommunications (Telecom) Program for FY2021. The rates in the dataset are collected from several data sources such as Funding Request Forms (FCC Form 466, (Telecom Program), FCC Form 462 (Health Care Connect Fund (HCF)), FCC Form 471 (E-Rate), Tariff, and other approved sources by the FCC. The dataset can be used in calculating median rural and urban rates that can be entered into the FCC Form 466 application for the Telecom Program.

All information within the FCC Forms 462, 466, and 471 data collection is self-reported by applicants.
columns_name: Service Provider Name or Study Area Name
columns_description: This is the unique identifier of the record in the dataset generated by our system.

Identification of rate as either a duplicate rate or a distinct rate. Duplicate Rates are rates that have the same dollar amount (excluding decimals/rounded down to nearest dollar) for the same service provider identification number (SPIN), service type, bandwidth, state, and rurality tier. The first occurrence of a duplicate rate as well as rates that do not fall under the duplicate rates definition are considered Distinct Rates. Only Distinct Rates are used to determine median rates.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information about the FRN line items within each FCC Form 471, including individual product/service data, costs, quantities, and descriptions.   Use this dataset can answer questions about the individual products or services used by the applicant for their broadband connectivity, the cost of individual products or services, and the quantity of individual products that are funded by E-Rate.   All FCC Form 471 information contained within the FRN Line Items dataset is self-reported by E-Rate applicants.  USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Any value less than 100 percent indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: CAF Disbursements and Locations Data
resource.description: This dataset provides information at the Study Area Code (SAC) level about dollar amounts paid to carriers that participate in Connect America Fund (CAF) programs, the number of locations these carriers have deployed with CAF support and their total deployment obligations by location count.
columns_description: Year when data was reported in High Cost Universal Broadband (HUBB) portal.

Total amount of funding disbursed to carriers as of the filing year and prior years. The “amount disbursed” may occasionally show a negative number. This is a result of prior period adjustments, audit recoveries, or other factors.

The 6-digit Study Area Code (SAC) is a unique number assigned to each Eligible Telecommunications Carrier (ETC) based on its service area. A carrier with multiple service areas within a single state will have multiple SACs.
Number of locations to which the carrier must deploy broadband, for the fund, in the Study Area.

Amount of funding disbursed to carriers as of the filing year. The “amount disbursed” may occasionally show a negative number. This is a result of prior period adjustments, audit recoveries, or other factors.
Total number of locations receiving CAF funds deployed within the corresponding filing year.
Individual High Cost fund in which the carrier participates. See High Cost Funds Glossary for details.
Total number of locations receiving CAF funds deployed  within the corresponding filing year and prior years.
State abbreviation for carrier receiving High Cost support.
Name of the company participating in High Cost funding

domain_tags: connect america fund broadband loop support
connect america fund phase ii auction

domain_metadata.value: This dataset presents information at the Study Area Code (SAC) level about dollar amounts paid to carriers that participate in Connect America Fund (CAF) programs, the number of locations these carriers have deployed with CAF support and their total deployment obligations by location count. This dataset is based on CAF disbursement data, and broadband deployment data reported and certified by carriers in the High Cost Universal Broadband portal, or HUBB, as of March 06, 2024, to reflect deployment through Dec. 31, 2023.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Any value less than 100 percent indicates a field with missing values.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information about annexes from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC).  An annex is a secondary site of an individual school that is in a different physical location than the primary facility, but is still considered part of the same school. For data about entities, please reference the dataset titled “E-Rate Entity Information.”   All information within the Annex data collection is self-reported by applicants.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: Emergency Connectivity Fund FCC Form 471
resource.description: This dataset contains data from each Emergency Connectivity Fund (ECF) FCC Form 471 including applicant details such as applicant type, Billed Entity Number (BEN), student count, dollars requested and approved, as well as related information from the ECF portal;  data from each Funding Request Number (FRN) including service provider and contract information, Funding Commitment Decision Letter (FCDL) related data, and invoicing details; and data from each FRN line item ID including individual product/service data, costs, quantities, and descriptions.

resource.name: E-Rate Invoices and Authorized Disbursements (FCC Forms 472 and 474)
resource.description: The E-Rate Invoices and Authorized Disbursements (FCC Forms 472 and 474) dataset provides invoicing data for applicants, service providers, and other stakeholders so they can track invoice lines completed and authorized for disbursement. The dataset includes invoice lines authorized on July 1, 2016 and after and does not include in-process, pending, or cancelled invoice lines. The dataset includes invoice and FCC Form 471 related data so users can filter and sort the data accordingly.

resource.name: Lifeline Companies Near Me
resource.description: This dataset provides the information of all the carriers providing Lifeline service, their customer service number, service type, state, and URL. The purpose of this dataset is to provide the most accurate list of carriers providing service in a particular area within a given state, through the use of zip codes. To ensure that this data is up-to-date and accurate, it is refreshed periodically to add new carriers and the corresponding zip codes of their designated service areas, update the zip codes for existing carriers, and remove zip codes for carriers that have relinquished their ETC designation. In the event that a user enters a zip code that does not return any service provider(s), a complete listing of the state in which the zip code is found will be returned with the recommendation that the consumer confirm the availability of Lifeline service in their chosen zip code with a service provider from that state.

resource.name: High Cost: Connect America Fund Broadband Map (CAF Map)
resource.description: This dataset serves as the foundation for the Connect America Fund Broadband Map (CAF Map), an interactive online map that shows the impact of the Connect America Fund (CAF) on broadband expansion to close the digital divide in rural America. The CAF Map displays the geographic areas that are eligible for CAF support, as well as the specific fixed locations where carriers participating in the program have built out mass-market, high-speed Internet service. The dataset includes address, latitude and longitude coordinates, carrier name,  filing year and minimum speeds offered for every location where CAF-supported service is available. The information in this dataset comes directly from carriers, which submit broadband deployment data annually through USAC’s High Cost Universal Broadband (HUBB) portal showing where they have built out service using CAF funding. The current CAF Map is based on data certified in the HUBB as of March 06, 2024, to reflect broadband deployment through Dec. 31, 2023. USAC independently verifies deployment to a random sample of locations reported in the HUBB each year to monitor carrier compliance with CAF build-out obligations.

If a search needs to be performed by SPIN, please refer to the legacy Funding Disbursement Search Tool, which includes all total support dollars disbursed and total subscribers claimed from 2004 to the present. Use this dataset to answer questions such as: What are the individual service types? What quantity of service did the applicant request? Which service provider is supplying service and what is the length of the contract? What discount did the applicant receive on services? Did the applicant request funding for fiber? All information within the Connectivity Information (FCC Form 471) dataset is self-reported by applicants.
